intro: Gomphrena globosa subsp. africana, commonly known as the African globemallow, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spherical, showy flower heads that range in color from pink to red, which are composed of numerous small, papery bracts. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. Gomphrena globosa subsp. africana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
